title: About
content:
It’s the first NGO and non-profit mexican organization that develops programs and initiatives to leverage women in technology and brings girls closer to a field that was mostly owned by the boys: coding.

Jobs in Computer Science are growing as at a faster rate than students in computer science majors. The 98% of leadership roles in the tech industry are filled by men in the world but this ratio is even worst in mexico. 

We create programs that educate girls and women in the technology sector.

We have 3 programs: Epic Queen Chapter, Code Party and Epicademy.

**Epic Queen Chapter** 
With this program we make visible every month 3 women that are already in technology to become role models in a meet-up event.

**Code Party**
For 3 hours in a weekend girls around 6 to 12 years are inspired by basic programming exercises to become creators of technology rather than consumers.

**Epicademy**
Epicademy is a series of courses that focus on two audiences:
Girls 7 to 12 years that learn about science, robotics and coding.
Women from 18 and older who want to learn about technology in different areas and topics.

Our model:
Through important alliances, we started meetup sessions in the most important co-working spaces in 10 different cities in Mexico.
